SEARCH
Package uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop

Class RenderingUtils

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop.RenderingUtils
public final class RenderingUtils extends Object
Utility class for calculating rendering positions of vehicles on screen. This class converts game world coordinates (grid positions and pixel offsets) into screen coordinates for drawing.

This class cannot be instantiated as it only provides static utility methods. It helps the rendering system determine where to draw vehicles as they move between grid cells.

Key Concepts:

  • Cell Position: The grid cell a vehicle is in (e.g., row 5, column 10)
  • Pixel Offset: How many pixels the vehicle has moved within its current cell
  • Render Position: The actual screen coordinates (top-left corner) for drawing
  • Render Center: The center point of the vehicle for precise positioning

Example Usage:

 Vehicle train = new Locomotive(world, startPos, Orientation.EAST);
 
 // Get the top-left corner position for drawing
 Point topLeft = RenderingUtils.getRenderPosition(train);
 graphics.drawImage(trainImage, topLeft.x, topLeft.y, null);
 
 // Get the center position for precise calculations
 Point center = RenderingUtils.getRenderCenter(train);
 graphics.drawLine(center.x, center.y, otherX, otherY);
See Also:

  • Orientation

  • Method Details

    • getRenderPosition

      public static Point getRenderPosition(Vehicle v)
      Calculates the top-left screen position where a vehicle should be drawn.

      This method takes the vehicle's grid position and pixel offset to calculate exactly where the vehicle should appear on screen. As the vehicle moves between cells, the pixel offset increases and the position changes smoothly.

      Parameters:
      v - the vehicle to get the render position for
      Returns:
      a Point containing the x,y screen coordinates of the vehicle's top-left corner

    • getRenderCenter

      public static Point getRenderCenter(Vehicle v)
      Calculates the center screen position of a vehicle.

      The center position is useful for drawing connections, calculating distances, or any operation that needs the middle of the vehicle rather than its corner.

      Parameters:
      v - the vehicle to get the center position for
      Returns:
      a Point containing the x,y screen coordinates of the vehicle's center
